content:
CollectionDataContractAttribute Class

In this Article

When applied to a collection type, enables custom specification of the collection item elements. This attribute can be applied only to types that are recognized by the DataContractSerializer as valid, serializable collections.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct, AllowMultiple=false, Inherited=false)]
public sealed class CollectionDataContractAttribute : Attribute

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Attribute
  • CollectionDataContractAttribute

Remarks

The CollectionDataContractAttribute is intended to ease interoperability when working with data from non-WCF providers and to control the exact shape of serialized instances. To this end, the ItemName property enables you to control the names of the repeating items inside a collection. This is especially useful when the provider does not use the XML element type name as the array item name, for example, if a provider uses "String" as an element type name instead of the XSD type name "string".

The CollectionDataContractAttribute is also intended to be used with dictionary types to handle keyed collections. Dictionary types are classes that implement either the IDictionary or the IDictionary<TKey,TValue> interface, for example, the Dictionary<TKey,TValue>. Use the KeyName and ValueName properties to set custom names when using the Dictionary<TKey,TValue> class.

For more information about using the DataContractSerializer, see Using Data Contracts.

Constructors

  • CollectionDataContractAttribute()

    Initializes a new instance of the CollectionDataContractAttribute class.

Properties

  • IsItemNameSetExplicitly

    Gets whether stem.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute.ItemName* has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsItemNameSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the item name has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • IsKeyNameSetExplicitly

    Gets whether stem.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute.KeyName* has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsKeyNameSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the key name has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • IsNameSetExplicitly

    Gets whether stem.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute.Name* has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsNameSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the name has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • IsNamespaceSetExplicitly

    Gets whether stem.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute.Namespace* has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsNamespaceSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the item namespace has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • IsReference

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to preserve object reference data.

    public bool IsReference { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true to keep object reference data; otherwise, false. The default is false.

    Remarks

    The IsReference setting does not apply to the elements of the collection.

  • IsReferenceSetExplicitly

    Gets whether reference has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsReferenceSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the reference has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • IsValueNameSetExplicitly

    Gets whether stem.Runtime.Serialization.CollectionDataContractAttribute.ValueName* has been explicitly set.

    public bool IsValueNameSetExplicitly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      Returns true if the value name has been explicitly set; otherwise, false.

  • ItemName

    Gets or sets a custom name for a collection element.

    public string ItemName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name to apply to collection elements.

  • KeyName

    Gets or sets the custom name for a dictionary key name.

    public string KeyName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name to use instead of the default dictionary key name.

  • Name

    Gets or sets the data contract name for the collection type.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The data contract name for the collection type.

  • Namespace

    Gets or sets the namespace for the data contract.

    public string Namespace { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The namespace of the data contract.

  • ValueName

    Gets or sets the custom name for a dictionary value name.

    public string ValueName { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name to use instead of the default dictionary value name.
